data.title: A good bet.
data.text: Over all, a good place to go and I would go again.  You certainly couldn't ask for more in the warmth of the owner and staff, which makes for a very pleasant evening.  We had a group of eight, and the reaction to the food was mixed - mine was very good, but I ordered a predictable carbonara dish, while another's meal was dry.  So go, but ask the server for their recommendations.

data.title: lunch sandwiched in between seminars
data.text: Attended a conference at the Convention Center and Osteria is right across the street. Made a reservation thank goodness as they were jammimg busy and our reservation was honored 20 minutes early. Pizza was very good- salad accompanying was also quite good. Only complaint- very noisy so if you want a quiet intimate place for lunch this is not the place to go.

data.title: Diverse menu of Italian specialties
data.text: I had lunch here with a group and the waitress was very gracious about the separate checks for expense accounts.  Food was great and service was prompt.  Also attended a catered party in their private room and the food was excellent with very attentive service.

data.title: Great place by the convention center
data.text:
This is literally across the street from the convention center, so convenient if you are at a convention.  However, it has great food, which is not the usual when across the street from a convention center.  
I had the burrata appetizer (summer version), which was large enough for at least 2 people and quite tasty.  I also ordered what I thought was cappelini with garlic and oil, but apparently I ordered one with tomato sauce.  It was a nice portion and tasty as well.

data.title: Excellent meal but couldn't hear!
data.text:
Four of us had excellent meals covering spaghetti, sausage dish, appes like artichoke, mozzarella, etc. The service was excellent...so friendly, loved the atmosphere, nice decor etc. The only problem was that we had to yell at each other due to the noise in the dining room and bar. We would have sat at the bar first but it was just too loud.
We'll try it during the week and hopefully its a more comfortable setting to talk.
When the noise is loud, I can't taste the food as well.........

data.title: Great Food and Atmosphere
data.text: Great wine, great service and incredible food. My wife and I split a calamari and then we split an entree which was pasta and meatballs and it was plentiful and delicious. We had the house wine (red cab sauv) and it was very good. After having the meatballs this time i know why they won the meatball competition.

data.title: Great Find in Buffalo
data.text: There are a lot of good beer in Buffalo but not a lot of good Italian restaurants, until we stumbled on Osteria.  The staff is welcoming, the food is very good and the atmosphere is cozy.  We order drinks, appetizers (octopus - yum), pasta and seafood specials, pork sandwich, ravioli, and everything was excellent.  This place offers great food that won't bust your wallet.  For the four of us our our total bill was $128 plus tip 🙂

data.title: Pizza Scissors?
data.text:
Our reception was warm and friendly, our server quite laidback. He seemed to be almost waiting on our table because he was in the neighborhood. My wife and I couldn't decide whether or not to split one pizza or order separately. After way too much discussion with the server we finally decided we'd each order our own to keep things simple.

When the pizzas were delivered her veggie pie was fine. The pepperoni on mine was just slightly burned. It was not burned badly enough to warrant sending it back and yet badly enough to inhibit my enjoyment of it. Rather than go through the hassle I just ate the toppings I liked. It was not memorable in a positive way.My assessment was that they were struggling so I chose not to make an issue of it.

Each pizza was delivered uncut and with a pair of kitchen shears to allow us to do our own cutting. This was not a welcome presentation. They could have improved on their performance by being more attentive to us, not burning my pepperoni, and slicing our pizzas for us.

data.title: Best Italian
data.text:
This is a quant location and though we did not have reservation, we sat in the bar, there was live music, the staff was engaging and helpful with suggestions and history of the restaurant. 
We got a little Spaghetti with Sunday Sauce, we had to know our waitress gave us the history of Sunday sauce, we also ordered a pizza with pepperoni, this had the creamiest, mozzarella and the pepperoni  had just the right flavor, this is a must if in Buffalo.

data.title: Try The Calamari Frittata or The Carbonara
data.text: The perfect Buffalo restaurant with a comfortable atmosphere and excellent food.  The service is fast and friendly and this spot is in the middle of everything.

data.title: Great dinner!
data.text: We stopped here for dinner as a group of family and friends, there were 9 of us and we made a reservation ahead of time. The food was delicious! Everyone ordered different foods and everyone was pleased with their choices! We didn't feel crowded even though we were in a large group in the dining area. Mitchell was our waiter and he was fantastic and accommodating to any requests from the group. We will definitely be back!

data.title: Pleasant experience
data.text: I had a great meal here. I was dining solo and the staff made me feel at home and were very attentive. The drinks were good, the food was really good. I do wish they would have a tiramisu on the menu though. Overall a very pleasant experience

data.title: Authentic wonderful cuisine
data.text: The veal parmigiana took me right back to Italy this place, the food, the ambiance even the pictures on the wall telling the story of this wonderful Italian family.. then as we were leaving we met the owner himself fabulous visit...

data.title: One of the best
data.text: Excellent food, good staff, obviously very popular with the local after-work crowd. I had a plate of linguini with a cream sauce, diver scallops and shrimp. Could hardly be better. My wife would say the same about the pasta and mariner sauce she had. Two issues for me. One is that they play extremely loud rock music in the bar and dining area, which I think is a serious detraction and does not seem appropriate to the place. I would not eat there unless I could sit in their small patio outside, along the sidewalk. The second (a complaint I would make about many Buffalo restaurants) is that they are 90 minutes from a major wine region (the Finger Lakes) and don't carry any wines from there.

data.title: Fantastic food
data.text: Wow loved the food. We had lunch here and a meal off their special board ... pesto, shrimps and linguine, fabulous. We were given bread with a dip of chilli flakes, grated parmesan and olive oil yummy. The service was excellent and they had a full restaurant. Highly recommend this place, should be much higher on the ranking system.

data.title: A hidden gem in the city of Buffalo
data.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants. The food never disappoints us. We have been there for sit down table meals, brunch, and outdoor street events. It's always an adventure to eat the Italian specialties that the chef has created. Don't miss the brunch when they have them! The atmosphere is a very calm, enjoyable, and friendly touch. We love the artistic décor. You will get to meet the owner Nick and/ or management because they want to make your dining experience perfect.

data.title: On our way to the UP of Michigan
data.text: The restaurant was within walking distance of the hotel.  On the way we could see the lake in the distance.  The wait staff was very efficient and the food was delicious.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere!
data.text: My son and I were on a road trip from Chicago checking out colleges.  Osteria 166 was an oasis on our trip.  We had the Bucatini Carbonara and Sausage & Campanelle  which were both excellent!  We also enjoyed the fresh bread and fabulous service.  We would go back if we are ever in the area.

data.title: Best Italian downtown Buffalo
data.text:
Great atmosphere and excellent food. 
Comfortable for eating alone or with customers.  
Attentive well versed staff. 
Solid drink menu. 
Decent prices.

data.title: Very Good
data.text:
Really cool building and bar/restaurant in downtown Buffalo. Food and service are excellent. I had the Swordfish which was done just right and not overcooked. My wife had the Rib Eye and that was very good also.
Great selection of wine and beer. Live music at times. Great addition to downtown Buffalo! Been meaning to get here for some time and finally did.
